margin.translation[0].definitions[0].def: the empty space at the side of a page
margin.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: Someone had scribbled a note in the margin.
Use double spacing and wide margins to leave room for comments.
margin.translation[0].definitions[1].def: the difference in the number of votes, points etc that exists between the winners and the losers of a competition or election
margin.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: They’re a world-class team and it was no surprise that they won by such a wide margin.
The bill was approved by a margin of 55 votes.
by a margin of 10 points/100 votes etc
margin.translation[0].definitions[2].def: the difference between what it costs a business to buy or produce something and what they sell it for
margin.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: Margins are low and many companies are struggling.
Within 10 years they had a gross profit margin of 50%.
margin.translation[0].definitions[3].def: an additional amount of something such as time, money, or space that you include in order to make sure that you are successful in achieving something
margin.translation[0].definitions[3].exa: It’ll take about 30 minutes to dry but I’d allow a safety margin of, say, another 10 minutes.
margin.translation[0].definitions[4].def: the edge of something, especially an area of land or water
margin.translation[0].definitions[4].exa: the western margin of southern Africa
margin.translation[0].note_box[0].headin: – Meaning 1: the empty space at the side of a page
margin.translation[0].note_box[0].sectio: The margins are very narrow, making the page look cluttered.
Leave a generous margin at the side of the page.
There were some notes written in the right-hand margin.
All typing begins at the left-hand margin.
The teacher told us to leave a margin wide enough for him to write corrections.
Set the margins to have one inch on each side.
margin.translation[0].note_box[1].headin: – Meaning 2: the difference in the number of votes, points etc that exists between the winners and the losers of a competition or election
margin.translation[0].note_box[1].sectio: By a large margin, the book sold more copies than any other this year.
They won the championship by a huge margin.
Visitors from other parts of Scotland exceeded foreign visitors by only a small margin.
The proposal passed, but only by a narrow margin.
win by a large/small etc margin
The party won by a huge margin.
lose by a large/small etc margin
He lost by only a narrow margin.
margin.translation[1].definitions[0].def: the difference between the price that something is sold for and the cost of producing or buying it. A margin is usually calculated as a percentage of the price that something is sold for, unlike a MARK-UP which is calculated as a percentage of the cost of producing or buying it
margin.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: Prices and margins were down as a result of the recession.
The car division, suffering from weak sales and tight margins (=very small ones), made an operating loss.
The margin on canned soup is 15% to 20%.
margin.translation[1].definitions[1].def: if you buy shares or other investments on margin, you buy them with borrowed money
margin.translation[1].definitions[1].exa: Individuals trading on margin sustained heavy losses during last year’s stock price declines.
